chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Back in the rich people would use stones as numerals to keep count of their important possessions like horses.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " stone " and " horse ", it is often used as a symbol and tool to express numbers. Such as "page number", "number", "size", "chips", "weights".

" Code " in modern Chinese can mean shelving and neglect. "The Heroes of the Sons and Daughters" Chapter 30: "Lie Gong, please listen to Miss He's explanation. According to Inoue's words, this is called putting friends there."

Modern Chinese " code " is also used as a quantifier, equivalent to " back ", " kind of ." Used to refer to one thing or class of things. Zhou Libo <Li Dagui watching the ceremony>: "Heh, those are two different things, you should cook quickly, don't be verbose."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " stone " and " horse ", it is often used as a symbol and tool to indicate number.
humanum_full_description:
從「石」，「馬」聲，常用作表示數目的符號和工具。如「頁碼」、「號碼」、「尺碼」、「籌碼」、「砝碼」。

　　近代漢語中「碼」可表示擱置、冷落。《兒女英雄傳》第30回：「列公請聽，何小姐這段交代，照市井上外話說，這就叫把朋友碼在那兒了。」

　　現代漢語中「碼」還用作量詞，相當於「回」、「種」。用來指一件事或一類事。周立波〈李大貴觀禮〉：「呵，那是兩碼事，你快做飯吧，別再囉嗦了。」
humanum_short_description: 從「石」，「馬」聲，常用作表示數目的符號和工具。

從「 石 」，「 馬 」聲，常用作表示數目的符號和工具。如「頁碼」、「號碼」、「尺碼」、「籌碼」、「砝碼」。 近代漢語中「 碼 」可表示擱置、冷落。《兒女英雄傳》第30回：「列公請聽，何小姐這段交代，照市井上外話說，這就叫把朋友碼在那兒了。」 現代漢語中「 碼 」還用作量詞，相當於「 回 」、「 種 」。用來指一件事或一類事。周立波〈李大貴觀禮〉：「呵，那是兩碼事，你快做飯吧，別再囉嗦了。」
From the sound of " stone" and " horse", it is often used as a symbol and tool to express numbers. Such as "page number", "number", "size", "chips", "weights". " Code" in modern Chinese can mean shelving and neglect. "The Heroes of the Sons and Daughters" Chapter 30: "Lie Gong, please listen to Miss He's explanation. According to Inoue's words, this is called putting friends there." Modern Chinese " code" is also used as a quantifier, equivalent to " back", " kind of." Used to refer to one thing or class of things. Zhou Libo : "Heh, those are two different things, you should cook quickly, don't be verbose."

碼字的基本解释

碼
mǎ
见“码”。

碼字的汉语字典释义

[①]［mǎ］
［《廣韻》莫下切，上馬，明。］
“码1”的繁体字。
(1)见“碼碯”。
(2)表示数目的符号。
(3)表示数目的用具。
(4)搁置；冷落。
(5)方言。堆叠；垒起。
(6)方言。按；依照。
(7)方言。取消。
(8)见“碼頭”。
(9)见“碼子”。
(10)量词。相当于“回”、“种”。用来指一件事或一类事。
(11)方言。量词。相当于“堆”或“垛”。
(12)英语yard的译名。英制长度单位，1码等于3英尺，合0.9144米。

碼字的康熙字典解释

【午集下】【石字部】　碼； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页833第33
【廣韻】【正韻】莫下切【集韻】母下切，?音馬。碼碯，石似玉。亦作瑪。

碼字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
碼字的起名意思

暂无。

code
Basic explanation of words
code
mǎ
See "code".
code
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［mǎ］
["Guangyun" Mo down cut, mount, Ming. ]
Traditional characters of "Code 1".
(1) See "Matching".
(2) A symbol indicating the number.
(3) Appliances that indicate the number.
(4) Shelved; left out.
(5) Dialects. Stack up;
(6) Dialects. Press; follow.
(7) Dialects. cancel.
(8) See "Wharf".
(9) See "Code Sub".
(10) Quantifiers. Equivalent to "return" and "kind". Used to refer to one thing or class of things.
(11) Dialects. quantifier. Equivalent to "pile" or "pile".
(12) The translated name of English yard. An imperial unit of length, 1 yard equals 3 feet, or 0.9144 meters.
code

[Guang Yun] [Zheng Yun] Do not cut down [Ji Yun] Cut down the mother,? Sound horse. The code is like jade. Also as Ma.
